intro: Manulea arabidea, commonly known as the Arabian manulea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh, dry climate. Manulea arabidea is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to survive in low-water environments.
